function_reachability: Is it impossible for function 'puts' to reach function 'malloc'?
Is it impossible for function 'puts' to reach function 'main'?
Is there a call path from function 'main' to function 'strlen'?
Is there a call path from function 'fizzBuzz' to function 'strcpy'?
loop_reachability: Can the loop with condition 'i < n' be skipped entirely?
Is the loop with condition 'i < n' always executed?
Is it possible that the loop with condition 'i <= n' is never executed?
Is the loop with condition 'i <= n' always executed?
dominators: Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'i < n' without passing through its header block?
Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'i <= n' without passing through its header block?
data_dependency: Does the value assigned to 'buf (line 4)' affect subsequent computations?
Is variable 'n (line 5)' used after its definition?
liveness: Does variable 'res (line 6)' remain in use at the end of function 'fizzBuzz'?
Is variable 'k' live at the end of function 'fizzBuzz'?
dead_code: Can the statement 'return res;' be considered dead code?
Can the program actually reach the statement: “char **res = NULL;”?
